```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(rio)
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidytext)
rstats <- import(here("data", "rstats_tweets.rds"))
```


```{r}
ggplot(rstats, aes(x = display_text_width)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "blue",
                 bins = 4)
# Larger the number of bins, the better you are able to see the distribution of display_text_width data
ggplot(rstats, aes(x = display_text_width)) +
  geom_histogram(color = "black",
                 fill = "blue",
                 bins = 50)

ggplot(rstats, aes(x = display_text_width)) +
  geom_histogram(color = "black",
                 fill = "blue",
                 bins = 25)

ggplot(rstats, aes(x = display_text_width)) +
  geom_histogram(color = "black",
                 fill = "blue",
                 bins = 10)

summary(rstats$display_text_width)
```

```{r}
#Is the below counting the total number of time the word "plot" is mentioned or is it the number of rows (inidividual posts) in which "plot" is mentioned??
plot <- grepl("plot|Plot", rstats$text)
sum(plot)
```
